alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:33AM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At Eddington affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River at Medford. * WHEN...From this afternoon to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, River approaches bankfull. At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Medford Road between Alder Brook to Robin Hollow Drive. Minor flooding along the lowland areas from Trestle Road Bridge downstream to Maxfield townline. Minor flooding along River Road and North Howland Road to I-95 Bridge in Maxfield to Howland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - At 12.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 03/28/1953. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 445 PM EST.
